comment: By far my favorite professor. No test or quizzes, just lots of modules, five video assignments, one paper, and one PowerPoint project. Every assignment is given an in-depth rule brick, so as long as you follow it, youll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Gillis is BY FAR the best professor I have ever had. He cares about each one of his students and wants everyone to truly succeed in the long term. I have learned more from him in one class than 3 years of my education at KSU. The grade you get is really based on effort you put into this course. If you get the chance, TAKE HIM.
Good professor. Cares about students and really tries to prepare them to become the best teachers they can be. As long as you put in the work, you can get an A in his class.

Gillis is a fantastic teacher and role model. He absolutely knows what he's talking about, and has an answer for almost any pedagogical question you have. He is NOT a tough grader, no idea why anyone would say he is. He's very clear about what he wants, and fairly lenient on deviation so long as you show comprehension of the topic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: His assignments are hard and he will not make it easy to get an A, but if you want to do good in his class you can. He gives great feedback on the assignments and is willing to work with you to make your work A level.

Gillis is an inspiration. There is no doubt in my mind I will be a better teacher because of him. He's not always easy, but he let's you redo your work to fix your mistakes and gives great feedback on assignments. If you want an A he will help you get it. You can tell he just wants to make great teachers and to help his students grow.

We had to read a lot of books. You will have to learn by failure in his class, but he normally allows for some revisions on assignment. You can clearly tell he has favorites but he fairly grades everyone. He is very particular when grading and sometimes he poorly explains the assignments. Really hard to get an A. Attendance is part of your grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: His class is the toughest I have ever experienced in 5 years of college. His explanation of assignments are confusing at best. His directions often contradict his rubrics, and his feedback contradicts his directions. Appears to mean well, but seems to design his class as an obstruction to student success instead of a pathway toward achievement.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Gillis is a hard class, but he is very helpful and provides the most feedback of any professor I've ever had at KSU. He is a tough teacher and rude at times but he cares & offers to help in & out of school. As long as you work hard, ask questions when you have them, and improve throughout the semester you will pass with either an A or a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors at KSU! I learned so much from his class! He is always willing to help you, and he cares about his students. I have nothing but respect for Dr. Gillis!
